thread.title: It’s time for ‘Back to the Future’ Day
thread.title_full: It’s time for ‘Back to the Future’ Day

author: DERRIK J. LANG
title: It’s time for ‘Back to the Future’ Day
text:
It’s time for ‘Back to the Future’ Day Originally published October 21, 2015 at 7:00 am Updated October 21, 2015 at 6:21 am FILE – In this Nov. 9, 2013 file photo, Michael J. Fox attends A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To Cure Parkinson’s benefit for The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research, in New York. Presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders will appear on ABC’s “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” on Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. Kimmel’s show said another guest that night will be Fox, whose first “Back to the Future” film is marking its 30th anniversary. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP, File) 0 of 0 The Associated Press 
LOS ANGELES (AP) — The future is today — if “Back to the Future” is to be believed. 
The celebration of the so-called “Back to the Future” Day on Wednesday marks the date — Oct. 21, 2015 — that the characters Marty McFly, Emmett “Doc” Brown and Jennifer Parker famously journeyed from 1985 to 2015 in the sci-fi film trilogy’s second installment in 1989. 
“Back to the Future Part II” envisioned a colorful 2015 with flying cars, hoverboards and self-tying shoelaces. While those doodads are hardly prevalent today, the film did accurately tease the rise of such technology as flat-screen televisions, biometric scanning and hands-free gaming. It also predicted the Chicago Cubs winning the World Series — an actual possibility with the Cubs contenders in the real-world playoffs, although maybe not for long. Related 
'Back To The Future' fans: Austria issues hoverboard rules 
“Back to the Future” Day is being celebrated Wednesday with an appearance by the original cast at a Lincoln Center screening in New York, as well as several fan-centric events and more than 1,700 theaters hosting screenings across the country. (Michael J. Fox is scheduled to be a guest on ABC’s “Jimmy Kimmel Live!”) Most Read Stories
